meanings.definition: To make amends or reparation for (guilt or wrongdoing)
meanings.sent1: He expiates his mistake by apologizing sincerely.
meanings.sent2: She expiates her sins through acts of kindness.
meanings.sent3: The cat expiates knocking over the vase by bringing a toy as a peace offering.
meanings.sent4: His hard work expiates the errors of his past.
meanings.sent5: The sun expiates the darkness with its warm rays.

meanings.sent1: She expiates her lie by telling the truth.
meanings.sent2: He expiates his actions by volunteering at the shelter.
meanings.sent3: The clown expiates his silly pranks by performing magic tricks for charity.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness expiates the hurtful words she said.
meanings.sent5: The rain expiates the dry earth, bringing life to the plants.

meanings.definition: To relieve or cleanse of guilt
meanings.sent1: The confession expiates his guilt and brings him peace.
meanings.sent2: She expiates her conscience by doing good deeds.
meanings.sent3: The puppy expiates chewing the shoe by giving lots of puppy kisses.
meanings.sent4: His honesty expiates any doubts about his integrity.
meanings.sent5: The river expiates the land, washing away all traces of wrongdoing.
